The food was amazing; we could talk easily as not too loud. Going back again tomorrow!!

From the moment I rang the restaurant, the service stood out â€” the gentleman on the phone called me back multiple times and made sure every detail was taken care of. That level of responsibility and care is rare.

Once I arrived, the atmosphere was stylish yet welcoming, and the hand-rolls were beautifully made and fresh. Itâ€™s clearly a place with both flair and quality.

If Iâ€™m being completely honest, a couple of the more experimental rolls were a bit too over-the-top for my taste. But overall, it was a very good experience â€” one Iâ€™d recommend when youâ€™re looking for something a bit special and well-handled.

I had a good impression from about 4 years ago, and revisiting this time for the #makefoodnotwastenyc campaign but also glad to find that they have a full vegan set available!

The vegan rolls were good (allegedly much better than the normal set) but I did think itâ€™s too pricey for what it is and not enough surprise element. The kitchen seemed to be understaffed and hectic. It took a very long time for us to get each piece. Unlikely to go back again.

Nami nori is a small restaurant, but a hidden gem. 100% gluten free.

I ordered the signature set, and my friend ordered the starter set. I traded my coconut shrimp with her yellowtail jalapeÃ±o Tamaki roll. Everything was so delicious. My favorites in my set were the XO Scallop (it was spicy, citrus-y, and so delicious - and I don't normally eat raw scallops) and the Tuna Poke. I also enjoyed the yellowtail, salmon seranno, and cucumber sesame plum.

I like how they had the starter sets/signature sets so it was more cost efficient, but when I go back I hope to try the spicy crab dynamite and red crab California. Love this place!!

PS: Matcha was delicious and authentic!

We made a reservation, arrived, and there was no table available. They said they would seat us outside and move us inside once a table was ready.

They never did. The service was very slow, and even after insisting several times to be seated indoors, nothing happened.

We only chose this place because it was listed on the Blackbird app and had been on our list for a long time. However, at the end of the meal, they told us they werenâ€™t accepting payments through the app â€” another unpleasant surprise.

Definitely do not recommend. Worst experience weâ€™ve had in a long time.

By the way, they have a B rating for sanitary conditions, which is quite concerning for a sushi place.
Not as good as I expected, nothing special about it!
Great Temaki selection. Definitely recommend coming during lunch. The prices are a steal for NYC.
Great food. They have a great vegan combo that is a good value and delicious. They were very accommodating to allergies.
Perfect service, perfect food.

Ok food not great, standards dropped, smaller portions of late since my last visit. 4 clams in my clam soup and recalled there was more on previous visit. Also smaller portion of tuna dip.
But the deplorable service is what turns me off. Waitress seemed most disinterested. Hands me the bill and proceeds to chat with colleagues and be so engrossed in something else other than helping with the chq. I mean, if you would like me to leave without paying, sure! This place used to have better rep. Only the Mexican server was great service - he actually asked me how i was and looked me in the eye - wow service. The caucasian waitress should not be customer facing. Place her in the back is my advice!
Food and service were phenomenal

Iâ€™ve been to Nami Nori before and enjoyed it, but after last night, I wonâ€™t be returning. My partner and I arrived at 9:00 pm and were told by the hostess to wait 25 minutes for a table. She put us on the waiting list, took my number, and we waited outside as usual. At 9:25, I checked inâ€”she said the table still wasnâ€™t ready and that if no one left by 9:30, we wouldnâ€™t be seated, as the kitchen would be closing. At exactly 9:31, we were happy to see that multiple tables got up. We approached again, only to be toldâ€”rudelyâ€”that because it was now 9:31, we wouldnâ€™t be seated. We were absolutely stunned. After being told to wait outside for 30 minutes, we were denied a table over one minute. Iâ€™ve never experienced such classless treatment anywhere in the world. Thankfully, the restaurant next door welcomed us warmly and even served us after closing, simply because they couldnâ€™t believe how we had been treated by Nami Nori. Truly disappointing experience.
I loved the food and drinks here! Divine experience from beginning to end. Yum!
Tasty food with a fun and energetic environment to boot. Iâ€™m not sure any of their food would be a bad choice. Their menu has variety and is delicious.

We had a fine meal but it was nothing special. It felt a bit overpriced. The fish was a bit on the fishy side and the aka ebi had too much lime juice on it. My favorite hand roll was the sweet potato roll. I thought maybe I should have gotten the vegan set since those seemed better than the actual seafood ones. Nice staff although it felt like there was some chaos behind the counter and our rolls took a long time between rounds. The seats at the bar were also kind of tight and the person next to me felt a bit too close.

I was looking forward to trying this handroll place for lunch but I was sorely disappointed. The service was good and the environment was a bit cramped (which I understand space is limited in NYC). But the fish quality was way below my expectations. I thought for a specialty restaurant known for their handrolls their fish would be close to omakase quality however this was not the case. I would compare the tuna and salmon quality to that of which I have had in a $13 poke bowl in NJ (possibly lower). I think my $9 cup of clam miso soup was my favorite part of the meal. I mean no disrespect, but just wanted to share my opinion to hopefully save someone else from disappointment, or for the restaurant to see this and make some changes.
One of the best hand rolls in NYC

It was just OK. Not a big deal. I started to video the live roll making and suddenly they said we are not allowed to record them !! Why live cook then ğŸ«£.

I'd been excited to try this spot, and it lived up to my hopes. Nice environment, tasty meals, and friendly team members! Nami Nori West Village! You know how to create a good experience. Their kitchen understands quality. I could easily justify daily visits here.

Beautiful location and excellent sushi ğŸ£
Service was outstanding - you can make it quick or enjoy ğŸ˜‰
Indoor counter service and outdoor seating as well

10/10. Every single bite was so delicious. My friends and I ordered the caviar as an appetizer and we shared the signature set at the end. My favorite from my personal set was the fried oyster. Alex was great! Thank you so much.
The restaurant has a warm and inviting atmosphere. The food is enjoyable, and the prices are very reasonable, making it a great place to relax and dine.

Went for an early dinner on a weekend and the place was bustling. Place is small with a trendy bar counter setting. While service didnâ€™t feel rushed, we were in and out in less than an hour perhaps because of the concept where the food was served pretty quickly and the cramped seating doesnâ€™t make it comfortable to order more for a longer duration. The shisato pepper had an unusually intense spiciness (we are not new to this dish but somehow the particular batch was really too strong) that we could not finish. Ordered a variety of rolls which were mostly ok, some rather meh. The only notable was the nori which was consistently super crisp. My biggest discomfort with the place was that the â€˜chefsâ€™ (counter hand roll prep people) were not using gloves or wearing masks and they were talking to one another all the time over the rolls that they were making.  Also, they do allow you to order less than than 5 rolls if you want, although I had ordered the full 5 just to try out. Go if you are into the hip vibes or a quick fill if willing to splurge on overpriced temaki.

Nami Nori is a gem of a dining experience, blending modern minimalism with an inviting warmth that instantly sets it apart. From the moment you step inside, the sleek yet cozy ambiance draws you in, with blonde-wood benches adorned with soft gray-blue pillows and two U-shaped counters that make the art of temaki hand-rolled sushi the star of the show.

The open layout creates an intimate, communal vibe, perfect for watching the chefs craft each dish with precision and care.
The menu is a celebration of creativity and flavor, with temaki taking center stage alongside thoughtfully curated offerings like the vegetable miso soup with fried tofu and shishito, which is both comforting and vibrant. The chefâ€™s set is a must for adventurous diners, delivering unexpected yet harmonious combinations like salmon, onion cream, and tomato wrapped in crisp, toasted nori. Each bite is a revelation, with textures and flavors that feel both innovative and familiar. Standouts include the chopped toro on wasabi rice, sprinkled with scallions for a punchy, melt-in-your-mouth experience, and the broiled crab with spicy mayo, served in a nori shell studded with rice crackersâ€”a playful, crunchy delight thatâ€™s as fun to eat as it is delicious.
Vegan diners are far from an afterthought here. The plant-based options are just as inventive and satisfying, showcasing Nami Noriâ€™s commitment to inclusivity without sacrificing flavor. Every dish feels intentional, with fresh ingredients and bold seasonings that elevate the meal to something truly special.

Whether youâ€™re a sushi aficionado or just looking for a fresh take on Japanese cuisine, Nami Nori delivers a memorable experience thatâ€™s as visually appealing as it is delicious. Itâ€™s a spot that invites you to linger, savor, and return for more.
I only tried takeouts but their hand rolls are so good i completely understand the hype
Really good and nice experience
It was a grate experience tasty and it's the most fun to feel safe with it being 100% gluten free

All good.
except last piece in the signature set, Cucumber maki.
It.s a bit of disappointment..
Just simple cucumber slices in Gim with Gochujang paste sauce.. feels  rip-off to be on the signature menu..
Food is amazing, we visited the location in Brooklyn as well. The only issue is the fact they can't sell alcohol due to being within 500 ft of a church.
Highly recommended!! Everything was amazing.
First time coming here and I loved the experience so much! First off, you get to build your own sushi?? Second off, the fish is sooo fresh and delicious, itâ€™s worth the price.
Delicioso e apto para celÃ­acos! Voltaria 1000x

Great temaki spot! Video review down below but check out the full version on my IG/TikTok: @snacks.andthe.city :)

We got the nori chips with scallion dip (9/10), the spicy tuna dip (10/10), the signature set (8/10), the coconut shrimp (10/10), the XO scallop (9/10), the spicy lobster (9/10), the spicy crab dynamite (10/10), avocado toast (9/10), the toro scallion (7/10), salmon sashimi (8/10) and the mochurros (11/10).
Hand rolls were absolutely sensational, canâ€™t wait to go back. ğŸ‘Œ

Getting a table here can be difficult. But, I think the owner/management/hosts create a hype that causes more drama than it should. Or, the managers/hosts don't know what they're doing.
It was my first visit. I had heard that this place was great. Someone even assured me that it is better than Kazu Nori. Which I didn't believe and still don't believe. Although, the menu here is more interesting and creative.
We sat outside, which can be awkward. There are three (3) tables. A lot of people walking by and people standing and waiting for their reservations. We started with Braised Bamboo Shoots and Japanese Potato Salad. Both (2) were good. We tried many Temaki. Cucumber Black Sesame, Spicy Tuna, Toro Scallion, "Avocado Toast", Salmon Avocado, Yellow Tail,...and some others. Everything was good. There is an interesting way you help to prepare the Temaki at the table. They bring a box to the table with the seaweed wrappers and you prepare the final step. It's not a big deal and it's kind of 'fun'.
For dessert we tried the Churros with Lemon Cream. Those were really impressive. The lemon cream was well balanced. The service was excellent and our main waiter from a small town in Mexico was fantastic.
Overall, I liked it. I would go back and try other things. But, I would need a solid reservation and no waiting.
(I added bad photos with my review.)
Great place ğŸ‘ŒğŸ» Quick service, friendly staff, comfortable setting, and very good value. Highly recommend!

Stopped by for lunch with coworkers around 2pm â€” ended up waiting about 30 minutes since reservations were fully booked. Once seated at the sushi bar, the vibe was really nice: clean, modern, and stylish inside. The menu is simple, not too many items, but they also have drinks (including alcohol).

I went with the five-piece set (about $30â€“35). Portions were decent and I left feeling full. The fish was fresh, but not every roll hit the mark for me. Some flavor combos felt a little overhyped â€” one had a sesame/soy combo that leaned too salty, another had jalapeÃ±o that overpowered the fish, and there was a roll with lemon zest that was justâ€¦ a bit odd.

Overall, not a bad spot for lunch and definitely an experience to try once. I might come back for dinner to see if itâ€™s different, but I wouldnâ€™t call it one of the best hand roll places in NYC. Worth checking out for the ambiance and presentation, though!

I really enjoyed eating here. I ordered a signature temakis and itâ€™s really fresh and seasoned just right. The shrimp one I didnâ€™t expect to like very much but it was great. And the price is pretty reasonable for 5 temakis. One thing I didnâ€™t like is that you kind of had to get 5 temakis? Overall I would come back here dine again to try other temakis
Delicious experience, we are happy we decided to eat here!! Love the sushi-style yet alternative concept and the counter seats!
Terrible service from the guy who greets you. He makes you wait 45 minutes and never gives you a table or tells you one isn't available. Bad experience.

Stopped in for lunch and began with the shishito peppers. They werenâ€™t my favorite, but the signature set that followed more than made up for it. Each element was carefully prepared, flavorful, and well-balanced.

The cucumber black sesame was my least favorite, more for presentation than taste, as it was a bit messy to eat. Everything else, however, was executed beautifully and absolutely worth recommending.

~Phantom Eats will return. ğŸ‘»ğŸ´
Excellent service and food. The 5 stars reserved for after a second time!

I visited this place after hearing from Korean students that it was the best meal they had in New York. The interior is clean and minimal, and the prices are relatively reasonable. The dishes are well-presented and neatly arranged, but the flavors and aromas are quite strong.
I ordered the signature set, and I still remember the sharp wasabi hit from the first bite and the overpowering ssamjang (fermented soybean paste) flavor on the sauce over cucumbers at the end. Although itâ€™s a fusion Japanese restaurant, the taste was much bolder than I expected, which left me a bit disappointed.
As I walked out, I couldnâ€™t help but wonder, was it really necessary to wrap such crisp, fried ingredients in seaweed? Itâ€™s a place worth trying once, but I wouldnâ€™t say itâ€™s a must-visit.

Food, vibes, serviceâ€¦ everything was perfect in Nami Nori. Top notch!
